messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] au pairs
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/12/2004 5:26:22 PM Eastern Daylight Time, starsuncloud@netzero.net writes: A neighbor of mine worked from home. She had an Aupair that
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/12/2004 5:26:22 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:
A neighbor of mine worked from home. She had an Aupair that came to their
house three full days a week and did not live with them. I'm sure there are
differences in agencies and areas. I knew the Aupair personally, because we invited
her to the neighbor "moms groups" we started. She had been looking
specifically for part time, so maybe that made the difference. She was also relocating
over here, don't know how that affected it all. Maybe the term "nanny" would
have fit her better, but she referred to herself as an Aupair, as did her
employer.??<<<<

She's a baby-sitter! <g> Au pair sounds elegantly foreign! <BWG>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
